tool.name: velveth
tool.command:
velveth_jgi_wrapper.pl $output $output.extra_files_path $output.id $__new_file_path__
$range_input.range_select
#if $range_input.range_select == 'yes': $range_input.cov $range_input.size $range_input.offset $range_input.step #else $range_input.kmer #end if
#for $i in $shortLibs: #if $i.short.libtype == '-shortPaired' : #for $j in $i.short.files: $j.file #end for #else : $i.short.file #end if #end for
#if $shortUseLong.shortSelectLong == "yes": #for $i in $shortUseLong.long.files $i.filetype.file #end for #end if
velveth $output.extra_files_path range_temp #for $i in $shortLibs: -fmtAuto $i.short.libtype -$i.short_select #if $i.short.libtype == '-shortPaired' : #for $j in $i.short.files: $j.file #end for #else : $i.short.file #end if #end for #if $shortUseLong.shortSelectLong == "yes": $shortUseLong.long.libtype #for $i in $shortUseLong.long.files $i.filetype.select #end for #for $i in $shortUseLong.long.files $i.filetype.file #end for #end if #if $noHash : -noHash #end if #if $create_binary : -create_binary #end if $strand_specific

param.name: range_select
param.label: Do you want to have the tool generate an estimated range using velvetk or do you want to enter a manual range ?

param.name: cov
param.label: Enter the desired expected kmer coverage for velvetk to build the range.

param.name: size
param.label: Enter the expected size of the genome

param.name: offset
param.label: Enter the offset from the best kmer (should be even)

param.name: step
param.label: Enter the step size (should be even)

param.name: kmer
param.label: Enter the range of kmers you want the velvetg job to run on. In the format m,M,s (no spaces between commas) where m is the first kmer, M is the last (not inclusive) and s is the step size.
param.help: For example the input 1,17,4 will run velveth on the kmers 1, 5 , 9 and 13.

param.name: noHash
param.label: Just prepare Sequences file don't read hashs or make a Roadmaps file (default off)

param.name: create_binary
param.label: Create a binary CnyUnifiedSeq file (default off)

psssssaram.name: hash_length
psssssaram.label: Hash length. Odd numbers only. Maximum 75. Or min,max,increment as comma seperated values with no spaces

param.name: strand_specific
param.label: All libraries strand-specific?

param.name: short_select
param.label: Read 2 separate files for paired reads or the file contains paired reads that are interleaved (default)

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool preprocesses the sequence data using the specified hash length. A larger hash length increases sensitivity at the expense of read depth.
**Manual**
http://www.ebi.ac.uk/~zerbino/velvet/Manual.pdf
